p: As shown in Table 4, the most important causes of psychological disorders according to the participant's perspective were losing someone close (72.0%), stress form work and school (71.8%), and social responsibilities (70.2%). Almost half of the participants believed that a biological disorder was one of the most important causes of psychological disorders (50.6%). Environmental factors and genetics constituted the most important causes of psychological disorders according to 45.4% and 45.3% of the participants, respectively. In addition, 36.6% of the participants agreed that Black magic was a potential cause, while (36.5%) of participants agreed that the evil eye could be an attributed cause. Only 6.7% of the participants said that astrology leads to psychological disorders.
